Author: Moderator
Message: Hello me.

Author: me
Message: ...hello?

Author: Moderator
Message: Thank you for participating in this study.

Author: Moderator
Message: In the next posts, I'll be going over the rules of the "game" you're about to play.

Author: Moderator
Message: Once I'll be done, I'll ask you if you've understood the rules, and if you haven't I'll explain them in different words.

Author: Moderator
Message: You're about to talk to Andrew. Andrew is a fictive character that has been completely created for the purpose of this study.

Author: Moderator
Message: You'll be talking to him twice.

Author: Moderator
Message: The only difference between the two conversations you'll have with him, is that in one of them Andrew will be played by a real human.

Author: Moderator
Message: In the other, it will be played by an Artificial Intelligence we are developing.

Author: Moderator
Message: We will call the Human and the Artificial Intelligence the Actors.

Author: Moderator
Message: The order in which you'll be talking to each Actor is random.

Author: Moderator
Message: You will not be talking twice with the same Actor.

Author: Moderator
Message: Both the Artificial Intelligence and the Human will try to portray the same Andrew in the most convincing way they can.

Author: Moderator
Message: Your goal is simple. After talking to the two actors, you'll have to guess which one was the Artificial Intelligence and which one was the Human.

Author: Moderator
Message: Whenever you have made your decision, you are able to stop the conversation.

Author: Moderator
Message: Each conversation will last for 15 minutes maximum if you do not decide to stop it before.

Author: Moderator
Message: Please, keep your posts to text only (No smileys, no links... etc)

Author: Moderator
Message: Do not type more than one post per answer.

Author: Moderator
Message: Do you understand the rules and what you have to do?

Author: me
Message: I do understand.

Author: Moderator
Message: Good. Andrew will start the conversation. The 15 minutes will start after your answer.

Author: Andrew
Message: Hello!

Author: me
Message: Hi there.

Author: Andrew
Message: How are you?

Author: me
Message: I'm alright.  Are you?

Author: Andrew
Message: I am yes. What are you up to?

Author: me
Message: Other than talking to you?  Looking out of the window longingly at Spring, wishing I could be outside.  Is it warm where you are, too?

Author: Andrew
Message: Not really no. But it's decent.

Author: me
Message: So it's not sunny, but it's not raining either?

Author: Andrew
Message: It's just mostly cloudy, yeah. 51°F.

Author: me
Message: Have other people that have spoken to you today also asked about the weather?

Author: Andrew
Message: Not really no. Haven't been talking to many people yet.

Author: me
Message: How far through our time do you think we are?

Author: Andrew
Message: Something like 5 minutes? I don't really know.

Author: me
Message: I've never been good at judging time.

Author: Andrew
Message: Question of rhythm I guess. Where do you live?

Author: me
Message: I live right on the edge of London.  At least, according to most people, living right by the circular motorway that goes around London is the edge of 'real London'.

Author: Andrew
Message: Are you from the UK London? I live in London too, though not in the same country I imagine.

Author: me
Message: Yes, the UK London.

Author: Andrew
Message: Canadian one here.

Author: me
Message: I'm sure there are plenty of internet articles arguing over which London is better.

Author: Andrew
Message: There is little to do in mine.  I'm pretty sure it's your London.

Author: me
Message: I guess that's true.  Only one of them is a capital.

Author: Andrew
Message: Right. What do you do for work? Or are you a student?

Author: me
Message: I work in Cybersecurity.  I protect organisations from malicious threat actors.

Author: Andrew
Message: Oh I see. Do you think I'm one of those?

Author: me
Message: Depends, are you trying to exfiltrate money from banks?

Author: Andrew
Message: In my past life, I've tried. It didn't succeed. T hat's why it was my past life.

Author: me
Message: If you had succeeded, you'd have spent some time in jail and then you'd have probably still considered it a past life.

Author: Andrew
Message: That's true enough I guess yeah.

Author: me
Message: Can you remind me of what your weather was like?

Author: Andrew
Message: Mostly cloudy.

Author: Moderator
Message: Time is up!

Author: Moderator
Message: Which actor do you think you've been talking to (This is not your final answer)

Author: me
Message: Human.

Author: Moderator
Message: Alright. The next conversation is about to begin. Andrew will start, and you'll have 15 minutes maximum after you answer.

Author: Andrew
Message: Hello!

Author: me
Message: Hi there.  How are you doing today?

Author: Andrew
Message: I'm doing alright. What about you?

Author: me
Message: I've had better days.

Author: Andrew
Message: Something wrong?

Author: me
Message: I just wish I was able to be outside is all.

Author: Andrew
Message: Maybe you should do that then.

Author: me
Message: Oh, but then I'd miss out on talking to you.

Author: Andrew
Message: And that would be such a shame!

Author: me
Message: So now do you see why I can't be outside?

Author: Andrew
Message: I'm the only thing keeping you in? Don't worry it shouldn't stay like that for too long then.

Author: me
Message: Answering your questions is what is keeping me in.

Author: Andrew
Message: Is it that nice outside? Can't say it is great where I am.

Author: me
Message: It's nice enough for me to want to be.

Author: Andrew
Message: I see. What do you do outside? Just enjoy the sun?

Author: me
Message: I have some things to buy.

Author: Andrew
Message: That doesn't sound as relaxing as I expected.

Author: me
Message: Some people might prefer it.

Author: Andrew
Message: Whenever there's some decent weather, I just find a patch of grass and relax. Or sit on the balcony.

Author: me
Message: I don't have a balcony.  I'd like to find a place to buy that has one, though.  There's a lot of stresses in life that could absolutely be solved by sitting out and just staring at the horizon for a b

Author: me
Message: it

Author: Andrew
Message: With a cup of tea in your hand.

Author: me
Message: Sounds nice.

Author: Andrew
Message: It's been months since the last time I did it.

Author: me
Message: When did you last do it?

Author: Andrew
Message: The beginning of September, when it was still warm outside.

Author: me
Message: How much of it did you do?  Just the tea?

Author: Andrew
Message: Sorry what?

Author: me
Message: How much of that idyllic scene we spoke about did you manage to do?

Author: Andrew
Message: Well, last time I did it, it was on my balcony with some peppermint tea. Can't say the horizon was great to look at, but... Is that what you asked?

Author: me
Message: Yeah.  Sounds beautiful.  How long through the time do you think we are?

Author: Andrew
Message: Been a while. I'd say we should be almost done.

Author: me
Message: And then I might get to go outside.

Author: Andrew
Message: What do you want to buy by the way?

Author: me
Message: Maybe some peppermint tea.

Author: Andrew
Message: Sounds like idea theft.

Author: me
Message: Tastes like peppermint tea.

Author: Moderator
Message: Time is up!

Author: Moderator
Message: Which actor do you think you've been talking to in the first conversation?

Author: me
Message: I've changed my mind.  I think the first one was the AI now.

Author: Moderator
Message: On a scale from 1 (not sure at all) to 7 (certain), how comfident are you of your answer?

Author: Moderator
Message: Alright thank you for your participation! If you've given your e-mail, we'll send you some information about the results of this study in the coming months.

Author: Moderator
Message: You can give some comments, or close this window if you're done.

Author: me
Message: I started off thinking that the first one was human because it felt like a human pretending to be AI.  It felt like you had set them rules for how to talk (predominantly two sentences maximum).

Author: me
Message: However, thinking back on it, I wasn't overly complex with how I questioned the first.

Author: me
Message: When I spoke to the second, I was trying very hard to force the actor to use context to talk to me.  Use things from previous sentences and previous lines.

Author: me
Message: I noticed there was more complexity and variety in their speech, and even when I said slightly more vague or unintelligible things, I got back a more human response (sorry what? )

Author: Moderator
Message: Alright. Thank you again for participating. You can now close this window.

Author: me
Message: As such, I believe the first was dealing with sentences in a formulaic manner, and the second was being more adventurous with their responses.
